strong.span: Central Heights ISD Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Updates

span.span: Following the guidance of Centers Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and local health officials regarding the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, this page will be updated with the most current information for the Central Heights community.

Siguiendo la guía de los Centros de Control y Prevención de Enfermedades (CDC) y funcionarios de salud locales con respecto a la nueva pandemia de coronavirus (COVID-19), esta página se actualizará con la información más actualizada para la comunidad del campus.

strong.a: CDC Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Website
Texas Department of State Health Services

div.class: custom_152301 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: UPDATE: April 21, 2020
Dear Central Heights ISD Family,

I am sure that you have all heard by now that Texas Governor Greg Abbott has closed classrooms for the remainder of the 19-20 school year. With that being said, we still have a few weeks of on-line instruction and/or instructional packets before the year is officially over.
A few dates to remember going forward:

CHISD will resume meal distribution beginning on Monday, April 27th. Instead of daily meals, we will be going to a twice weekly schedule that will take place on Monday's and Wednesday's from 11:00 am — 1:00 pm. Lunch and breakfast will be given for 2 days on Monday's and for the remainder of the week on Wednesday's. This will continue thru May 20th.
CHISD will continue offering instruction on-line as well as curbside packet pick-up in front of the offices of each campus.
Monday's 11:00 am - 1:00 pm or 3:30 pm — 5:30 pm
Tuesday's 11:00 am - 1:00 pm or 3:30 pm - 5:30 pm
Elementary will not have new packets on April 27th and 28th (The packets that were given out on April 20th and 21st contain 2 weeks of work). All other grade levels will be available.
May 4th and 5th will be the last week that new assignments will be given. Any and all remaining assignments should be turned in on May 11th or 12th to allow time to get them to the teachers.
May 11th and 12th – Personal items that may have been left in lockers at Spring Break will be gathered and available at these times.

May 18th and 19th will be set aside for students to return textbooks, calculators, library books (not including those given away during the closure), athletic equipment, etc... *Coaches will be contacting athletes regarding procedures for returning gear.
Elementary students will drop off at the back door of the Elementary gymnasium.
Middle School students will drop off at the west door of Johnson gymnasium.
High School students will drop off at the east door of Johnson gymnasium.
Athletes will drop off uniforms and practice gear at the front door of the Fieldhouse.
*** All drop-off times are from 10:00 am - 2:00 pm on May 18th and 19th.
We are in the process of planning an event or events to recognize and honor the Central Heights SeniorClass of 2020. More details to be released at a later date.

div.class: custom_149300 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: UPDATE: April 3, 2020
CHISD Employee of the Food Service Department has tested positive for the COVID-19 virus. Please see link below for the official statement from Superintendent, David Russell.
El empleado de CHISD del Departamento de Servicio de Alimentos ha dado positivo por el virus COVID-19. Consulte el siguiente enlace para ver la declaración oficial del Superintendente, David Russell.
Official statement regarding CHISD Employee COVID-19 Virus

div.class: custom_149309 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: UPDATE: April 2, 2020

Beginning on Friday, April 3rd, CHISD will discontinue meal pick up until further notice. The district will continue instructional material pick up on Mondays and Tuesdays as previously scheduled. We apologize for any inconvenience that this causes and look forward to getting back on a normal schedule.

A partir del viernes 3 de abril, CHISD suspenderá la recolección de comida hasta nuevo aviso. El distrito continuará recogiendo material de instrucción los lunes y martes según lo programado previamente. Nos disculpamos por cualquier inconveniente que esto cause y esperamos volver a un horario normal.
David Russell, CHISD Superintendent

div.class: custom_149315 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: UPDATE: March 31, 2020
Today, March 31st, Texas Governor Greg Abbott ordered all Texas schools closed until at least May 4. CHISD will continue packet and meal distribution using our previously announced schedule.

Hoy, 31 de marzo, el gobernador de Texas Greg Abbott ordenó el cierre de todas las escuelas de Texas hasta al menos el 4 de mayo. CHISD continuará la distribución de paquetes y comidas utilizando nuestro servicio previo Horario anunciado.
David Russell, CHISD Superintendent

div.class: custom_149320 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: After visiting with other Area Superintendents over the weekend, CHISD has decided to extend its closure thru April 17th. Both the city and county of Nacogdoches have declared a " stay home " order starting at noon today. I have communicated with Greg Sowell (County Judge) and this does not pertain to the delivery of instructional materials and student meals. Please click on the link below for more details.

Después de visitar a otros Superintendentes del Área durante el fin de semana, CHISD decidió extender su cierre hasta el 17 de abril. Tanto la ciudad como el condado de Nacogdoches han declarado una orden de "quedarse en casa" a partir del mediodía de hoy. Me he comunicado con Greg Sowell (Juez del Condado) y esto no se refiere a la entrega de materiales de instrucción y comidas de los estudiantes. Haga clic en el enlace de abajo para obtener más detalles.
David Russell, CHISD Superintendent

div.class: custom_149335 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: UPDATE: March 29, 2020

Dear CHISD Family,
I have communicated with County Judge Greg Sowell and he says that the “ stay at home” order that has been issued does not pertain to the delivery of or pickup of instructional materials or school meals. We will continue the schedule that we used last week and ask that no one exits there vehicle while on campus. Please continue to practice social distancing and thoroughly washing your hands.

Querida familia de CHISD:
Me he comunicado con el juez del condado Greg Sowell y él dice que la orden de "quedarse en casa" que se ha emitido no se refiere a la entrega o recogida de materiales de instrucción o comidas escolares. Continuaremos el horario que utilizamos la semana pasada y pediremos que nadie salga del vehículo mientras esté en el campus. Continúe practicando el distanciamiento social y lavándose bien las manos.
David Russell, CHISD Superintendent

div.class: custom_149337 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: UPDATE: March 19, 2020

After meeting with Area County Superintendents on March 18th, it was unanimously agreed upon to keep schools closed until April 3rd. We will meet again on March 25th to re-evaluate the situation and determine where we go from April 3rd forward. Please read the attached document for the full version.

Después de reunirse con los Superintendentes del Condado del Área el 18 de marzo, se acordó por unanimidad mantener las escuelas cerradas hasta el 3 de abril. Nos reuniremos nuevamente el 25 de marzo para reevaluar la situación y determinar a dónde vamos desde el 3 de abril en adelante. Por favor lea el documento adjunto para la versión completa.
David Russell, CHISD Superintendent

span.a: Click here for update details for March 19, 2020

div.class: custom_149339 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: UPDATE: March 18, 2020

CHISD Parents and Students,
Due to school closings related to COVID 19, Central Heights will be offering curb side pick-up of meals to children age 18 and under. This will continue on Monday thru Fridays until school re-opens for regular classes.Sack lunches will include lunch for that day and breakfast for the next morning. Pick-ups will take place from 11:00 am until 12:30 each day at the North end of the Elementary Cafeteria.

Padres y Estudiantes de CHISD,
Debido a los cierres de escuelas relacionados con COVID 19, Central Heights ofrecerá servicio de recogida de comidas en la acera a los niños de 18 años y menores. Esto continuará de lunes a viernes hasta que la escuela vuelva a abrir para las clases regulares. Los almuerzos incluirá almuerzo para ese día y desayuno para la mañana siguiente. Las recogidas se llevarán a cabo desde las 11:00 am hasta las 12:30 cada día en el extremo norte de la cafetería primaria.
David Russell, CHISD Superintendent

div.class: custom_149341 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: UPDATE: March 16, 2020

CHISD Parents and Students,
Due to school closings related to COVID 19, Central Heights will be offering curb side pick-up of meals to students who qualify for Free and Reduced Lunch beginning on Tuesday March 17th. This will continue on Monday thru Fridays until school re-opens for regular classes. Sack lunches will include lunch for that day and breakfast for the next morning. Pick-ups will take place from 11:00 am until 12:30 each day at the North end of the Elementary Cafeteria. You will need to provide names for the students who qualify.

Padres y Estudiantes de CHISD,
Debido a los cierres de escuelas relacionados con COVID 19, Central Heights ofrecerá la recogida de comidas en el lado de la acera a los estudiantes que califiquen para almuerzo gratis o reducido a partir del martes 17 de marzo. Esto continuará de lunes a viernes hasta que la escuela vuelva a abrir para las clases regulares. Los almuerzos en saco incluirán almuerzo para ese día y desayuno para la mañana siguiente. Las recogidas se llevarán a cabo desde las 11:00 am hasta las 12:30 cada día en el extremo norte de la cafetería primaria. Deberá proporcionar nombres para los estudiantes que califican.
David Russell, CHISD Superintendent

div.class: custom_149344 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: After much consideration and conferencing with administrators and other superintendents around the county about the spread of COVID 19, it has been decided that Central Heights ISD will extend its’ Spring Break for another week and resume classes on Monday, March 23rd. We will continue to follow information provided by the Texas Department of State Health Services, and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. This is an unprecedented event for most districts within our state and we will keep you posted on any further changes.

This means that all events that were scheduled for March 16th- March 22nd are cancelled and will be rescheduled at a later date if the calendar permits. This includes the Orchestra Concert scheduled for March 17th as well as the Angelina College ESL informational meeting on March 19th.

The University Interscholastic League has cancelled all extra-curricular activities beginning March 16th thru March 29th. We will not be holding any practices thru next week (March 22nd) and student athletes will be updated about further practices by their coaches. The District Executive Committee will decide when any district contests will be rescheduled.

Después de mucha consideración y conferencia con los administradores y otros superintendentes de todo el condado sobre la propagación de COVID 19, se decidió que Central Heights ISD extenderá sus vacaciones de primavera durante otra semana y reanudará las clases el lunes 23 de marzo. Continuaremos siguiendo la información proporcionada por el Departamento de Servicios de Salud del Estado de Texas y los Centros para el Control y la Prevención de Enfermedades. Este es un evento sin precedentes para la mayoría de los distritos dentro de nuestro estado y lo mantendremos informado sobre cualquier cambio adicional.

Esto significa que todos los eventos programados para el 16 y 22 de marzo se cancelan y se reprogramarán en una fecha posterior si el calendario lo permite. Esto incluye el Concierto de orquesta programado para el 17 de marzo, así como la reunión informativa de Angelina College ESL el 19 de marzo.

La liga interescolar universitaria ha cancelado todas las actividades extracurriculares desde el 16 de marzo hasta el 29 de marzo. No realizaremos ninguna práctica hasta la próxima semana (22 de marzo) y los atletas estudiantes recibirán información sobre las prácticas adicionales de sus entrenadores. El Comité Ejecutivo del Distrito decidirá cuándo se reprogramarán los concursos del distrito.
David Russell, CHISD Superintendent

div.p: Provide a safe learning environment for all students and develop well- educated leaders of character who are prepared for the global leadership challenges of the future.
